channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-21177] Optimize AcidUtils.getLogicalLength()
item.description: AcidUtils.getLogicalLength() - tries look for the side file OrcAcidUtils.getSideFile() on the file system even when the file couldn't possibly be there, e.g. when the path is delta_x_x or base_x. It could only be there in delta_x_y, x != y.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I added checks so that we don't look for the side file if we don't have to.

We have another issue.  Operations like Load Data/Add Partition, create base/delta and place 'raw' (aka 'original' schema) files there.  Split gen and read path need to know what schema to expect in a given file/split.  There is nothing in the file path that indicates what it is so it opens one of the data files in base/delta to determine that: AcidUtils.isRawFormat().

This should be less of an issue, since it does a listing first to choose the file, so it should never be looking for a file that is not actually there. I optimized isRawFormat() some but it will do the checks a lot of the time. It could be changed to rely on the file name instead but that's rather fragile.

-1 overall

ATTACHMENT ID: 12956826 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Any reason why the #readOps jumped for test case testACIDReaderFooterSerializeWithDeltas (for 2 of the asserts)? Would be good to list those 2 new calls in the comment for reference.

ParsedDeltaLight pd = ParsedDeltaLight.parse(fs.getFileStatus(baseOrDeltaDir));

fs.getFileStatus(baseOrDeltaDir) is counted - it wasn't performed before.

I removed some of the comments since they were clearly out of date (even before the current patch)
Looks like only path is used inside ParsedDeltaLight. So this fs.getFileStatus() call can be avoided? One less fs operation.
patch 3 - some more refactoring to use Path rather than FileStatus

-1 overall
